text: Almost any decision is better than no decision — just keep moving.
author: Danielle LaPorte

text: Go a little easier on yourself, and in so doing, be prepared to make and do things that might seem silly at first. Just keep moving: don’t ruminate and stare at the wall. Don’t just play with your phone: go out and produce something
author: Merlin Mann

text: Commitment is the ignitor of momentum.
author: Peg Wood

text: One way to keep momentum going is to have constantly greater goals.
author: Michael Korda

text: Success seems to be connected with action. Successful people keep moving. They make mistakes, but they don’t quit.
author: Conrad Hilton

text: You don’t close a sale, you open a relationship if you want to build a long-term, successful enterprise.
author: Patricia Fripp

text: Success comes from taking the initiative and following up…persisting…eloquently expressing the depth of your love.  What simple action could you take today to produce a new momentum toward success in your life?
author: Tony Robbins

text: It is often when night looks darkest, it is often before the fever breaks that one senses the gathering momentum for change, when one feels that resurrection of hope in the midst of despair and apathy.
author: Hillary Clinton

text: Enthusiasm is the energy and force that builds literal momentum of the human soul and mind.
author: Bryant H. McGill

text: Most of life is routine – dull and grubby, but routine is the momentum that keeps a man going.  If you wait for inspiration you’ll be standing on the corner after the parade is a mile down the street.
author: Ben Nicholas

text: The world is wide, and I will not waste my life in friction when it could be turned into momentum.
author: Frances Willard

text: Sometimes being pushed to the wall gives you the momentum necessary to get over it!
author: Peter de Jager

text: You are always a student, never a master. You have to keep moving forward.
author: Conrad Hall

text: Sliding headfirst is the safest way to get to the next base, I think, and the fastest.  You don’t lose your momentum, and there’s one more important reason I slide headfirst, it gets my picture in the paper.
author: Pete Rose

text: When you have that window of opportunity called a crisis, move as quickly as you can, get as much done as you can.  There’s a momentum for change that’s very compelling.
author: Anne M. Mulcahy

text: Sometimes thinking too much can destroy your momentum.
author: Tom Watson

text: Always work hard.  Intensity clarifies.  It creates not only momentum, but also the pressure you need to feel either friction, or fulfillment.
author: Marcus Buckingham

text: Enthusiasm is the energy and force that builds literal momentum of the human soul and mind.
author: Bryant McGill

text: Whatever beginning goals you set for yourself, following through on them will build momentum and a sense of achievement and those small successes will point the way to bigger ones.
author: Pamela Glass Kelly

text: When you find yourself in the thickness of pursuing a goal or dream, stop only to rest. Momentum builds success.
author: Suzy Kassem

text: The BIG push means being able to develop and sustain momentum toward your goal; it is the process of actively replacing excuses with winning habits, the ultimate excuses blockers. Moreover, it is being willing to go to the wall for what you want or believe in, to push beyond your previous mental and physical limits, no matter what it takes.
author: Lorii Myers

text: Excitement must lead to immediate action or you will lose the power of momentum. More dreams die because we fail to seize the moment. Do it now!
author: Tony Robbins

text: Because our power is motivating, and gives momentum and ownership of changes to those who dream of failure.
author: Lisa McMann

text: Whatever beginning goals you set for yourself, following through on them will build momentum and a sense of achievement and those small success will point the way to bigger ones
author: Pamela Glass Kelly

text: Hope floats but effort propels.
author: Rob Liano

text: It’s very simple; just look at your life to see where you’re heading. You’re always in a momentum of something.
author: Maria Erving

text: If the road behind me is not growing ever longer, then it is likely that the feet underneath me are not moving any longer. And if my feet are not moving, I have somehow, somewhere traded this most glorious journey for lesser endeavors.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough

text: When you have momentum going, play the momentum.
author: Donald Trump

text: When the finish line seems too far away, remember how you felt when you were back at the starting line. Regain that motivation to recharge your momentum.
author: Toni Sorenson

text: Unwavering incremental change can create remarkable and monumental results.
author: Ryan Lilly

text: To advance, however far, is profitless unless the ground gained can be consolidated, or the momentum sustained.
author: Ludovic Kennedy

text: The step that we are on is only a step to the next place, and no step regardless of how massive is ever a destination.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough

text: The importance of momentum in your organization cannot be understated!
author: Miles Anthony Smith

text: Motivation is what gets you started. Commitment is what keeps you going.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Keep on going and the chances are you will stumble on something, perhaps when you are least expecting it. I have never heard of anyone stumbling on something sitting down.
author: Charles F. Kettering

text: Productivity is never an accident. It is always the result of a commitment to excellence, intelligent planning, and focused effort.
author: Paul J. Meyer

text: Most people fail not because of a lack of desire but because of a lack of commitment.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: Any man’s life will be filled with constant and unexpected encouragement if he makes up his mind to do his level best each day.
author: Booker T. Washington

text: Commitment is the foundation of great accomplishments.
author: Heidi Reeder

text: The quality of a person’s life is in direct proportion to their commitment to excellence, regardless of their chosen field of endeavor.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: Commitment is what transforms a promise into a reality.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: There’s a difference between interest and commitment. When you’re interested in doing something, you do it only when it’s convenient. When you’re committed to something, you accept no excuses; only results.
author: Kenneth Blanchard

text: Commitment is the little choices every day that lead to the final results we’re striving for.
author: Anonymous

text: It was the character that got us out of bed, the commitment that moved us into action, and discipline that enabled us to follow through.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: You cannot conquer what you are not committed to.
author: T.D. Jakes

text: When confronted with a challenge, the committed heart will search for a solution. The undecided heart searches for an escape.
author: Andy Andrews

text: The biggest commitment you must keep is your commitment to yourself.
author: Neale Donald Walsch

text: There are only two options regarding commitment; you’re either in or you’re out. There’s no such thing as life in-between.
author: Pat Riley

text: If you had started doing anything two weeks ago, by today you would have been two weeks better at it.
author: John Mayer

text: The real value of setting goals is not the recognition or reward, it’s the person we become by finding the discipline, courage, and commitment to achieve them.
author: Anonymous

text: Productivity is never an accident. It is always the result of a commitment to excellence, intelligent planning, and focused effort.
author: Paul J. Meyer

text: The most important element in the failure equation is your personal commitment to keep trying.
author: Catherine Pulsifer

text: There’s a difference between interest and commitment. When you’re interested in doing something, you do it only when circumstance permit. When you’re committed to something, you accept no excuses, only results.
author: Art Turock

text: Courage is the commitment to begin without any guarantee of success.
author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe

text: It is confidence in our bodies, minds, and spirits that allows us to keep looking for new adventures.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: Trust yourself. Create the kind of self that you will be happy to live with all your life. Make the most of yourself by fanning the tiny, inner sparks of possibility into flames of achievement.
author: Golda Meir

text: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Just believe in yourself. Even if you don’t, pretend that you do and, at some point, you will.
author: Venus Williams

text: Confidence comes not from always being right but from not fearing to be wrong.
author: Peter T. Mcintyre

text: Doubt kills more dreams than failure ever will.
author: Suzy Kassem

text: Argue for your limitations and, sure enough, they’re yours.
author: Richard Bach

text: Your confidence in your own voice will carry into all areas of your life.
author: Eileen Rose Giadone

text: Inaction breeds doubt and fear. Action breeds confidence and courage. If you want to conquer fear, do not sit home and think about it. Go out and get busy.
author: Dale Carnegie

text: As soon as you trust yourself, you will know how to live.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: Confidence is when you believe in yourself and your abilities, arrogance is when you think you are better than others and act accordingly.
author: Stewart Stafford

text: The most beautiful thing you can wear is confidence.
author: Blake Lively

text: When you have confidence, you can have a lot of fun. And when you have fun, you can do amazing things.
author: Joe Namath

text: Man often becomes what he believes himself to be. If I keep on saying to myself that I cannot do a certain thing, it is possible that I may end by really becoming incapable of doing it. On the contrary, if I have the belief that I can do it, I shall surely acquire the capacity to do it even if I may not have it at the beginning.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Confident people feel good about themselves already, so they spend their time making others feel good.
author: Beau Norton

text: Experience tells you what to do; confidence allows you to do it.
author: Stan Smith

text: If you have no confidence in self, you are twice defeated in the race of life. With confidence, you have won even before you started.
author: Marcus Garvey

text: Confidence is the most important single factor in this game, and no matter how great your natural talent, there is only one way to obtain and sustain it: Work!
author: Jack Nicklaus

text: One of the greatest regrets in life is being what others would want you to be, rather than being yourself.
author: Shannon L. Alder

text: To accept ourselves as we are means to value our imperfections as much as our perfections.
author: Sandra Bierig

text: I don’t want everyone to like me; I should think less of myself if some people did.
author: Henry James

text: To establish true self-esteem we must concentrate on our successes and forget about the failures and the negatives in our lives.
author: Denis Waitley

text: A healthy self-love means we have no compulsion to justify to ourselves or others why we take vacations, why we sleep late, why we buy new shoes, why we spoil ourselves from time to time. We feel comfortable doing things which add quality and beauty to life.
author: Andrew Matthews

text: Don’t forget to love yourself.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

text: When I loved myself enough, I began leaving whatever wasn’t healthy. This meant people, jobs, my own beliefs, and habits – anything that kept me small. My judgment called it disloyal. Now I see it as self-loving.
author: Kim McMillen

text: Love yourself first. So you know what you deserve.
author: Lucille Ball

text: One way to feel good about yourself is to love yourself, to take care of yourself.
author: Goldie Hawn

text: Ever loved someone so much, you would do anything for them? Yeah, well, make that someone yourself and do whatever the hell you want.
author: Harvey Specter

text: Loving ourselves works miracles in our lives.
author: Louise Hay

text: Love who you are, embrace who you are. Love yourself. When you love yourself, people can kind of pick up on that: they can see confidence, they can see self-esteem, and naturally, people gravitate towards you.
author: Lilly Singh

text: Don’t forget to tell yourself positive things daily! You must love yourself internally to glow externally.
author: Hannah Bronfman

text: “Love yourself enough to set boundaries. Your time and energy are precious. You get to choose how you use it. You teach people how to treat you by deciding what you will and won’t accept.
author: Anna Taylor

text: You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection.
author: Buddha

text: No one saves us but ourselves. No one can and no one may. We ourselves must walk the path.
author: Buddha

text: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
author: Buddha

text: You can search throughout the entire universe for someone who is more deserving of your love and affection than you are yourself, and that person is not to be found anywhere. You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe deserve your love and affection.
author: Buddha

text: It is better to conquer yourself than to win a thousand battles. Then the victory is yours. It cannot be taken from you, not by angels or by demons, heaven or hell.
author: Buddha

text: To keep the body in good health is a duty... otherwise we shall not be able to keep our mind strong and clear.
author: Buddha

text: Health is the greatest gift, contentment the greatest wealth, faithfulness the best relationship.
author: Buddha

text: We are shaped by our thoughts; we become what we think. When the mind is pure, joy follows like a shadow that never leaves.
author: Buddha

text: Thousands of candles can be lighted from a single candle, and the life of the candle will not be shortened. Happiness never decreases by being shared.
author: Buddha

text: To enjoy good health, to bring true happiness to one's family, to bring peace to all, one must first discipline and control one's own mind. If a man can control his mind he can find the way to Enlightenment, and all wisdom and virtue will naturally come to him.
author: Buddha

text: Infuse your life with action. Don't wait for it to happen. Make it happen. Make your own future. Make your own hope. Make your own love. And whatever your beliefs, honor your creator, not by passively waiting for grace to come down from upon high, but by doing what you can to make grace happen... yourself, right now, right down here on Earth.
author: Bradley Whitford

text: Life is 10% what happens to you and 90% how you react to it.
author: Charles R. Swindoll

text: Beginning today, treat everyone you meet as if they were going to be dead by midnight. Extend to them all the care, kindness and understanding you can muster, and do it with no thought of any reward. Your life will never be the same again.
author: Og Mandino

text: You are not here merely to make a living. You are here in order to enable the world to live more amply, with greater vision, with a finer spirit of hope and achievement. You are here to enrich the world, and you impoverish yourself if you forget the errand.
author: Woodrow Wilson

text: Do not wait; the time will never be 'just right.' Start where you stand, and work with whatever tools you may have at your command, and better tools will be found as you go along.
author: George Herbert
